The pelvis shows the sex of the skeleton-person. There's no accounting for the made-up term 'gender', so none of the many bullshit categories apply. There's another interesting fact: They can tell if a skeleton wore a wedding ring, and may have been married. If you wear a wedding ring on your "ring finger" for a long time, the bone underneath the ring becomes polished, and very smooth. Normally, bones have a slightly striated texture - they're not perfectly smooth. Unless you've worn a ring for a long time, that is.  Married? Not sure, but customs and other things notwithstanding, they can tell if you've worn an ornament on that hand. <TheMoreYouKnow.gif> permalink award report block reply
